titleStmt.title: L. B. Hamilton to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG1015

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Apprehension of Fugitives from Justice Papers, 1863-1867

body.p:
Owingsville Ky
Dec 23d 1865
To His Excellency
Thos. E. Bramblett
Governor of Kentucky
Sir

Jesse and David Underwood have been indicted in the Bath Circuit Court for the murder of Geo. A. Trumbo in the county of Bath on day of Sept 1865 and as the Presiding Judge of the County of Bath I petition your eExcellency to offer a reward for the apprehension of the said Jesse & David Underwood and their delivery to the Jailor of Bath County
in accordance with the statutes in such cases made and provided

Respectfuly yous
L B Hamilton
Presiding Judge Bath Conty

Reward $500. for Jesse & David Underwood for the murder of Geor A. Trumbo
offered 26th Dec 1865
